book.abstract: This is the Gentoo Developer Handbook, a continuing effort to centralize development policies across Gentoo and to also outline Gentoo's development systems and procedures.

part.title: Introduction
part.abstract: This part covers aspects which apply to most areas of Gentoo development. This section is only really relevant if you are a Gentoo developer; otherwise you should skip this.

chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.abstract: This section outlines the purpose of the Gentoo Developer Handbook.

chapter.title: Becoming a developer
chapter.abstract: This section aims to explain how one can become a Gentoo developer.

chapter.title: What you get
chapter.abstract: This section outlines what services are available to Gentoo developers.

chapter.title: Help for new developers
chapter.abstract: This section provides help and instructions for new developers.

chapter.title: Developer hierarchy
chapter.abstract: This section outlines the hierarchy of Gentoo Developers and development.

chapter.title: Staff member policy
chapter.abstract: This section outlines recruitment and retirement policies for Gentoo staff members.

part.title: Guides
part.abstract: This section outlines and explains various development processes and provides standards for Gentoo developers.

chapter.title: Ebuild HOWTO
chapter.abstract: This section describes the Gentoo Linux Portage system, how to create new packages for Gentoo, and is also meant to be somewhat of a standard for the Gentoo Developers. It is a work in progress, and is constantly being updated and changed. It is by no means complete. You should always use this in conjunction with the manpages provided by portage (especially ebuild(5)) and the Gentoo Linux Development Policy.

chapter.title: Eclass HOWTO
chapter.abstract: This section aims to provide developers with a guide detailing how eclasses work and how they can be applied to ebuilds.

chapter.title: Common ebuild Mistakes
chapter.abstract: This section explains the frequent ebuild writing and submission mistakes made by contributors and developers.

chapter.title: Gentoo Metadata
chapter.abstract: This section explains the use and need of metadata.xml that is used within the Portage tree.

chapter.title: Ebuild Maintenance HOWTO
chapter.abstract: This section describes how developers would perform common tasks when maintaining ebuilds in the Portage tree.

chapter.title: Manifest Signing Guide
chapter.abstract: This section describes how developers can sign Manifests in the Portage tree using GPG.

part.title: Policies
part.abstract: This part covers the different policies which we expect developers to abide when committing items to CVS.

chapter.title: Ebuild policy
chapter.abstract: This section outlines the ebuild policy which every ebuild in Portage must follow.

chapter.title: Etiquette policy
chapter.abstract: This section outlines the etiquette policy for Gentoo developers.
